com.valentine.esp.packets

Class ESPPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.valentine.esp.packets.ESPPacket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InfDisplayData, InfV1Busy, RequestAllSweepDefinitions, RequestBatteryVoltage, RequestChangeMode, RequestDefaultSweepDefinitions, RequestFactoryDefault, RequestMaxSweepIndex, RequestMuteOff, RequestMuteOn, RequestOverrideThumbwheel, RequestSavvyStatus, RequestSerialNumber, RequestSetSavvyUnmute, RequestSetSweepsToDefault, RequestStartAlertData, RequestStopAlertData, RequestSweepSections, RequestTurnOffMainDisplay, RequestTurnOnMainDisplay, RequestUserBytes, RequestVehicleSpeed, RequestVersion, RequestWriteSweepDefinition, RequestWriteUserBytes, ResponseAlertData, ResponseBatteryVoltage, ResponseDataError, ResponseDataReceived, ResponseDefaultSweepDefinitions, ResponseMaxSweepIndex, ResponseRequestNotProcessed, ResponseSavvyStatus, ResponseSerialNumber, ResponseSweepDefinitions, ResponseSweepSections, ResponseSweepWriteResult, ResponseUnsupported, ResponseUserBytes, ResponseVehicleSpeed, ResponseVersion, UnknownPacket

    public abstract class ESPPacket
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for all the packets. Has all the basic functionality for getting source, destination, building from a buffer, and turning into a buffer to send to the Valentine One. Due to this class being abstract, it can't be created directly, but use the PacketFactory class to generate the right type of ESPPacket.

    • Method Detail

      • isSamePacket

        public boolean isSamePacket(ESPPacket rhs)
        Check the packet passed in to see if it contains the same data as this packet. Note that this is not a complete equality test. Instead, this method checks to see if the two packets are conveying the same information to the same target. We will not use these class members for the comparison m_valentineType - This may change based on the most recent infV1Display data, so it isn't used for the comparison lastKnownV1Type - This may change based on the most recent infV1Display data, so it isn't used for the comparison m_timeStamp - This may change throughout the packet lifetime and is not indicative of the type of equality this method is looking for. m_resent - This may change throughout the packet lifetime and is not indicative of the type of equality this method is looking for.
        Parameters:
        rhs - - The ESPPacket to use for the comparison
        Returns:
        true if the packets contain the same data, else false.

      • makeFromBuffer

        public static ESPPacket makeFromBuffer(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte> buffer,
                       ConnectionType type,
                       Devices lastV1Type)
        Takes an ArrayList of bytes and builds the resulting packet from that array.
        Parameters:
        buffer - ArrayList containing byte data read from the V1Connection device.
        type - Connection type, used to determine how to handle the buffer pack bytes.
        lastV1Type - The type of the type of the V1, the last time we received data.
        Returns:
        the new packet made from the buffer. Look at its packetIdentifier and cast to the correct type

      • trimBuffer

        public static void trimBuffer(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte> buffer,
              int trimToPosition)
        Trims all the bytes from the buffer from zero to a specified end point
        Parameters:
        buffer - Reference to the byte buffer that will be trimmed.
        trimToPosition - The position to stop trimming at.

      • isPacketFromV1

        public static boolean isPacketFromV1(byte originatorIdentifier)
        Helper method for determining if an originatorIdentifier is from a V1.
        Parameters:
        originatorIdentifier - The originator Id from an ESP packet.
        Returns:
        True if te originator Identifier matches a V1Connection, w/checksum or Legacy.

      • makeByteStream

        public static byte[] makeByteStream(ESPPacket packet,
                    ConnectionType connectionType)
        Turns the given packet into a byte array to be sent off to the Valentine One.
        Parameters:
        packet - The packet to be turned into a byte array.
        connectionType - The type of bluetooth connection to use to connect the bluetooth device i.e. LE_CONNECTION or SPP_CONNECTION. *
        Returns:
        Byte array that represents the packet. Delimited accordingly based on the connection type.

      • setNewV1Type

        public void setNewV1Type(Devices newV1Type)
        Changes the Valentine One type used to build this packet. If the current destination is a V1 type, the destination is changed to the new V1 type. identifier and rebuilds the packet
        Parameters:
        newV1Type - The new V1 type to use when building this packet.

      • getResponseData

        public abstract java.lang.Object getResponseData()
        Gets the data embedded into the packet. Should not need to call directly, data returned directly from the Valentine Client.
        Returns:
        An object representing the data in the packet. Cast to the correct type for the packet.
